properties.title: soapUI User Guide - for Web Service Testing

section.name: soapUI User Guide
section.p: The soapUI User Guide aims at giving an overview of all features available together with some explanations on the underlying implementations. The User Guide covers both soapUI, its IDE Plugins and soapUI Pro, sections and pages related to soapUI Pro are clearly marked. Read the feature comparison between soapUI and soapUI Pro here.

tr.td: Gives an overview of the soapUI interface, prerequisites and general functionality
Gives an overview of the soapUI tabbed desktop, a soapUI Pro only feature
Gives an overview of the soapUI License Management, a soapUI Pro only feature
Explains soapUI global preferences
Gives an overview of the soapUI Pro only XPath Selection feature
Explains how to use the global Groovy Script Library (soapUI Pro only)
Explains how to manage workspaces in soapUI
Explains projects and how to work with them
Details on how WSDLs are visualized and how to work with them
Explains the integrated WSDL Viewer
Shows how Operations are visualized and handled
Shows how to invoke web service operations and work with the request editor
Shows the functionality of the Form Editor an editor that simplifies Inspection
Shows the functionality of the Form Editor an editor for Request/Response Overview
Shows the functionality of a soapUI Pro only feature, The Message Inspectors
Shows how to use soapUI’s Attachment functionality
Gives an overview of functional testing of web services
A quick introduction to get you started with functional testing
Shows how to work with and run TestSuites
Describes TestCases, TestSteps and the TestCase editor
Shows how to set up TestRequest steps and validate response messages
Describes available response assertions and their usage
Shows the Editor Wizards. soapUI Pro only
Describes the PropertyTransfer Step and it can be used to transfer values between TestSteps
Describes the Conditional Goto Step and how it can be used to control TestCase execution
Shows how the Groovy Script Step can be used to perform arbitrary functionality in a TestCase
The Properties Step can be used to handle global properties in a TestCase
The Delay Step can be used to create pauses in a TestCase
The MockResponse Step can be used to create MockResponses in a TestCase
The DataSource Step can be used to collect data from a number of sources in a TestCase
The DataSource Loop Step can be used to loop a DataSource in a TestCase
Shows how property values easily can be used in requests and XPath expressions
Outlines soapUI LoadTesting functionality available for web services

td.a: Getting Started with Web Service Load Testing

tr.td: A quick introduction to get you started with load testing
Describes the available configuration options for running LoadTests
Describes how LoadTests are executed internally in soapUI
Shows the available LoadTest assertions and their usage
Describes the available real time diagrams and their contents
Compares soapUI functionality and performance to that of JMeter
Outlines soapUI’s web service mocking/simulation functionality

td.a: Getting Started With Web Service Simulation

tr.td: A quick introduction to get you started with load testing
Describes MockServices
Describes how MockOperations are used with MockServices
Describes how MockResponses are used with MockOperations
Outlines described scenarios for testing web services
Shows how to test a Web Service using external input data
Shows how to run a TestCase for a set of test values
Shows how to create TestCases with input or output dialogs for interactive demos and tests
Shows how to use a scheduling tool to run continuous functional and load-tests
Gives an overview of the available tool integrations in soapUI
Describes the available Code Generation integrations
Describes the available integrations for the WS-I Basic Profile validation tools
Describes the available integration for the Apache TcpMon tool
Gives an overview of the available command line tools in soapUI
Describes the command line runner for functional TestCases
Describes the command line runner for MockServices
Describes the command line runner for LoadTests
Describes the command line runner for Code-Generation integrations
Reference over available keyboard shortcuts
